Extension of <algorithm>¶

Short description…

Description of functions¶

template<typename InputIt, typename OutputIt>
OutputIt copy(InputIt first, InputIt last, OutputIt d_first, std::size_t n)¶

Copies n times the elements in the range [first, last), to another range beginning at d_first.

Type requirements:

  • InputIt must meet the requirements of LegacyInputIterator.

  • OutputIt must meet the requirements of LegacyOutputIterator.

Note

If any of the following conditions is satisfied, the behaviour is undefined:

  • T is not CopyConstructible.

  • T is not CopyAssignable

Parameters:

  • first, last – the range of elements

  • d_first – the beginning of the destination range

  • n – number of copies to be made

Throws:

std::invalid_argument – if n is smaller than one.

Returns:

Output interator to the element in the destination range, one past the last element copied.

template<typename BidirIt1, typename BidirIt2>
std::pair<BidirIt1, BidirIt2> mismatch_from_end(BidirIt1 first1, BidirIt1 last1, BidirIt2 last2)¶

Returns a pair of iterators to the last matching of elements from (last1, first1] and a range starting from last2 in reverse direction.

Second range has std::distance(first1, last1) elements.

Type requirements:

Bidir1 must meet the requirements of LegacyBidirectionalIterator Bidir2 must meet the requirements of LegacyBidirectionalIterator

Parameters:

  • first1, last1 – the first range of the elements

  • last2 – last element of second range

Returns:

std::pair with iterators to the last equal elements.

template<typename InputIt, typename T>
T product(InputIt first, const InputIt last, T init)¶

Computes the product of the given value init and the elements in the range [first, last).

Initialize the product prod (of type T) with the inital value init and then modify it with prod *= *i for every iterator i in the range [first, last).

Type requirements:

  • InputIt must meet the requirements of LegacyInputIterator.

Note

If any of the following conditions is satisfied, the behaviour is undefined:

  • T is not CopyConstructible.

  • T is not CopyAssignable

Parameters:

  • first, last – the range of elements

  • init – initial value

Returns:

prod after all modifications.

Examples¶
